intro: Bakerella hoyifolia var. itrafanaombensis, commonly known as the Itrafanaombensis Bakerella, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
